comment:
Disney makes a lot money out of Americam audiences- I am also sure that Disney wasn't happy with Depp's salary +. This was a chance to not have to pay his salary.
Disney is making a huge mistake. The character was created by Johnny Depp. The first Pirates of the Caribbean without that character would have just been another pirate movie.
We are dealing with 'woke' cancel culture and l can only wish these studios playing this game will realize  their fortunes depend on a public that won't be bullied in subtle ways.
To find someone guilty without looking into the situation is not professional. Warner has the same exact problems. They took out Johnny but had to pay him anyway, and 2nd film has not done that well. Johnny Debb is a draw and l believe a bigger one since all this happened. 
Now MGM is not releasing a  film that will probably be nominated for a foreign film Oscar nomination. Again this is just about cancel culture and ridiculous. MGM is making a big mistake. These days audiences want what they want and don't like to be messed with and definitely not be ignored. Over one million signatures against Amber means over at least a million people will not view the film.. 
That's a lot if money/views.. Just as many won't see Caribbean. And that is how reverse cancel culture works.

comment: Oh I know Disney is going to lose big on any Pirates of the Caribbean movie that does not star Johnny Depp as Captain Jack Sparrow.    I can say that because since the first movie I have been someone who probably, in the end of it all, spent close to $1,000 on tickets, DVD movies, clothing, toys, theme park visits, replica items, room decor and all the rest..... FOR EACH MOVIE!!!!!     However, I will NOT be spending so much as a penny on any POTC film without Mr. Depp in the starring role of said film, as our fantastical Captain Jack Sparrow.     And I am SURE that I am NOT the only person to have gone this same route over the years.   I will say, it was decent of Disney to give me an ending to POTC 5 that I could live with forever after if I must.   Captain Jack has his beloved ship, all curses upon him and anyone else connected with the sea are gone, and Jack is off to new adventures 'beyond the horizon'.
